cards.name: Persecute
cards.text: Choose a color. Target player reveals their hand and discards all cards of that color.
cards.flavor: "I want every last one of these tree-hugging, earth-loving, pointy-eared weaklings out of here. Now!"

rulings.text: The color is chosen on resolution.

cards.originalText: Choose a color. Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards of that color from it.

cards.name: Plague Beetle
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: No one knows whether they were named for the diseases they carry or for the speed at which they multiply.
cards.originalText: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a swamp.)

cards.name: Rag Man
cards.text: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Target opponent reveals their hand and discards a creature card at random. Activate this ability only during your turn.
cards.flavor: He hunts what might have been.
cards.originalText: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Target opponent reveals his or her hand and discards a creature card at random from it. Play this ability only during your turn.

cards.name: Raise Dead
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.

rulings.text: You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.

cards.originalText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Razortooth Rats
cards.text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor: They'll chew through armor, flesh, and bone. They'll even chew through each other if they're hungry enough.
cards.originalText: Razortooth Rats can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.

cards.name: Reprocess
cards.text: Sacrifice any number of artifacts, creatures, and/or lands. Draw a card for each permanent sacrificed this way.
cards.flavor: The battle's end is the meal's beginning.

rulings.text: You can sacrifice zero permanents if you want to.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice any number of artifacts, creatures, and/or lands. Draw a card for each permanent sacrificed this way.

cards.name: Revenant
cards.text:
Flying
Revenant's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: It eats death and drinks pain.

rulings.text: The ability that defines Revenant's power and toughness applies in all zones, not just the battlefield. If Revenant is in your graveyard, its ability will count itself.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Revenant's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

cards.name: Scathe Zombies
cards.flavor:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,
Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;
It had been strange, even in a dream,
To have seen those dead men rise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge,
"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

cards.name: Serpent Warrior
cards.text: When Serpent Warrior enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
cards.flavor: They're the fiercest of all the Western Paladin's soldiers. They're also the most fiercely loyal—but that loyalty comes at a price.

rulings.text: You can cast this if you have less than 3 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

cards.originalText: When Serpent Warrior comes into play, you lose 3 life.

cards.name: Soul Feast
cards.text: Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.
cards.flavor: You are who you eat.
cards.originalText: Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.

cards.name: Spineless Thug
cards.text: Spineless Thug can't block.
cards.flavor: What it lacks in backbone, it makes up for in cruelty.
cards.originalText: Spineless Thug can't block.

cards.name: Strands of Night
cards.text: {B}{B}, Pay 2 life, Sacrifice a Swamp: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: When the strands call, only the dead answer.
cards.originalText: {B}{B}, Pay 2 life, Sacrifice a swamp: Return target creature card from your graveyard to play.

cards.name: Stronghold Assassin
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target nonblack creature.
cards.flavor: The assassin sees only throats and hears only heartbeats.
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target nonblack creature.

cards.name: Tainted Aether
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, its controller sacrifices a creature or land.
cards.flavor: Pockets of Æther can be so foul they melt flesh from bone.

rulings.text: If the creature changes controllers before this ability resolves, its new controller has to sacrifice something.
If more than one of these is on the battlefield, the controller sacrifices a creature for each one of these.
If the controller has no other lands or creatures on the battlefield, they must sacrifice the creature that just entered the battlefield.
Tainted Aether's controller is the one that controls its triggered ability, but the controller of the creature that entered the battlefield chooses what creature they sacrifice during resolution.

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature comes into play, its controller sacrifices a creature or land.

cards.name: Unholy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
cards.flavor: "I don't feel any different."
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.

cards.name: Wall of Bone
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor: A skeletal wall, strengthened by the souls of traitors, rings the city of the Eastern Paladin.
cards.originalText:
(Walls can't attack.)
{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone.

cards.name: Western Paladin
cards.text: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target white creature.
cards.flavor:
"Expect nothing but scorn, flattery, and lies. And never turn your back on him."
—The Northern Paladin
cards.originalText: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target white creature.

cards.name: Yawgmoth's Edict
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a white spell, that player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: The warping of bodies and souls has become the heart of Yawgmoth's existence.
cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent plays a white spell, that player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Aether Flash
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, Aether Flash deals 2 damage to it.
cards.flavor: As the foul beast appeared, arcane lightning crackled around it.

rulings.text: This is not a targeted ability, so it deals damage to creatures that can't be targeted by spells and abilities.

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature comes into play, Æther Flash deals 2 damage to it.

cards.name: Balduvian Barbarians
cards.flavor:
"From the snowy slopes of Kaelor,
To the canyons of Bandu,
We drink and fight and feast and die
As we were born to do."
—Balduvian tavern song

cards.name: Bedlam
cards.text: Creatures can't block.
cards.flavor: The generals were dead. The battle plans were forgotten. It was everyone for themselves.
cards.originalText: Creatures can't block.

cards.name: Blaze
cards.text: Blaze deals X damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Fire never dies alone.
cards.originalText: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Bloodshot Cyclops
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Bloodshot Cyclops deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to any target.
cards.flavor: After their first encounter, the goblins named him Chuck.
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Bloodshot Cyclops deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target creature or player.

cards.name: Boil
cards.text: Destroy all Islands.
cards.flavor:
"It is a slaughter, the death of a sea. Never speak of it again."
—The Lord of Atlantis
cards.originalText: Destroy all islands.

cards.name: Crimson Hellkite
cards.text:
Flying
{X}, {T}: Crimson Hellkite deals X damage to target creature. Spend only red mana on X.
cards.flavor: The hellkites are artists with flames, painting the world with fire.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{X}, {T}: Crimson Hellkite deals X damage to target creature. Spend only red mana this way.

cards.name: Disorder
cards.text: Disorder deals 2 damage to each white creature and each player who controls a white creature.
cards.flavor:
"Fire hurts them almost as much as the chaos that follows. Almost."
—The Western Paladin

rulings.text: Players take 0 or 2 damage. Disorder does not do 2 damage per creature to the player.

cards.originalText: Disorder deals 2 damage to each white creature and each player who controls a white creature.

cards.name: Earthquake
cards.text: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature is without flying is only checked on resolution.

cards.originalText: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

cards.name: Fervor
cards.text: Creatures you control have haste. (They can attack and {T} as soon as they come under your control.)
cards.flavor: The intensity of their glare was soon surpassed by the intensity of their attack.

rulings.text: If an attacking creature loses haste, perhaps because Fervor leaves the battlefield after attackers have been declared, it won't be removed from combat.

cards.originalText: Creatures you control have haste. (They may attack and {T} the turn they come under your control.)

cards.name: Final Fortune
cards.text: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.
cards.flavor: A reward is worthless if you aren't around to enjoy it.

rulings.text: If you end up skipping the extra turn that is gained, you do not lose the game.
If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

cards.originalText: Take an extra turn after this one. At the end of that turn, you lose the game.

cards.name: Fire Elemental
cards.flavor: It treads on feet of coals and strikes with the force of a volcano.

cards.name: Ghitu Fire-Eater
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Ghitu Fire-Eater: It deals damage equal to its power to any target.
cards.flavor: The Ghitu believe their race was born of fire, and it's an honor to return to it.
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Ghitu Fire-Eater: Ghitu Fire-Eater deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.

cards.name: Goblin Chariot
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: The hardest part of his training is learning not to eat the boar.
cards.originalText: Haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Goblin Digging Team
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team: Destroy target Wall.
cards.flavor:
"Dig. Dig. Dig. Dig. Dig. Dig. Die"
—Goblin chant
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team: Destroy target Wall.

cards.name: Goblin Elite Infantry
cards.text: Whenever Goblin Elite Infantry blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
We're elite. You're not.
—Infantry motto
cards.originalText: Whenever Goblin Elite Infantry blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Goblin Gardener
cards.text: When Goblin Gardener dies, destroy target land.
cards.flavor: Years of attempts have brought the goblins no closer to growing a sausage tree.

rulings.text: The ability is not optional. You have to choose one of your own lands if your opponent has none.

cards.originalText: When Goblin Gardener is put into a graveyard from play, destroy target land.

cards.name: Goblin Glider
cards.text:
Flying
Goblin Glider can't block.
cards.flavor:
"What's got two arms, one wing, and no brains?"
—Ghitu riddle
cards.originalText:
Flying
Goblin Glider can't block.

cards.name: Goblin King
cards.text: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor: To be king, Numsgil did in Blog, who did in Unkful, who did in Viddle, who did in Loll, who did in Alrok. . . .

rulings.text: Goblin King now has the Goblin creature type and its ability has been reworded to affect *other* Goblins. This means that if two Goblin Kings are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

cards.originalText: All Goblins get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a mountain.)

cards.name: Goblin Matron
cards.text: When Goblin Matron enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

You can search for any card with the creature type Goblin, including Creature or Tribal cards. Older cards of type "Summon Goblin" and "Summon Goblins" also count. You can't search for cards that have Goblin in the name but don't have the creature type Goblin.

cards.originalText: When Goblin Matron comes into play, you may search your library for a Goblin card. If you do, reveal that card and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Goblin Raider
cards.text: Goblin Raider can't block.
cards.flavor: He's smart for a goblin. He can do two things: hit and run.
cards.originalText: Goblin Raider can't block.

cards.name: Goblin Spelunkers
cards.text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor: Goblins prefer caves to just about anything else. Caves prefer just about anything else to goblins.
cards.originalText: Mountainwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a mountain.)

cards.name: Goblin War Drums
cards.text: Creatures you control have menace. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
cards.flavor: The goblin idea of music is to hit something with a stick.

rulings.text: When combined with an effect that reads "Each creature you control can't be blocked by more than one creature," none of your creatures can be blocked.
Multiple War Drums are not cumulative. They are redundant.

cards.originalText: Each creature you control can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.

cards.name: Granite Grip
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 for each Mountain you control.
cards.flavor: "Let me introduce you to Rocky."
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 for each mountain you control.

cards.name: Hill Giant
cards.flavor: Hill giants are mostly just big. Of course, that does count for a lot.

cards.name: Impatience
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's end step, if that player didn't cast a spell this turn, Impatience deals 2 damage to that player.
cards.flavor: "I'm going to count to three. Three."

rulings.text: If a spell is countered, it still counts as having been cast.

cards.originalText: At the end of each player's turn, if that player didn't play a spell that turn, Impatience deals 2 damage to him or her.

cards.name: Inferno
cards.text: Inferno deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor:
"Some have said there is no subtlety to destruction. You know what? They're dead."
—Wandering mage
cards.originalText: Inferno deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Lava Axe
cards.text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: "Catch!"
cards.originalText: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.

cards.name: Lightning Blast
cards.text: Lightning Blast deals 4 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"I'll climb down soon. Don't worry, it's just a thundersto—"
—Former elvish scout
cards.originalText: Lightning Blast deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Lightning Elemental
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor:
"A flash of the lightning, a break of the wave,
He passes from life to his rest in the grave."
—William Knox, "Mortality"
cards.originalText: Haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Mana Clash
cards.text: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.

rulings.text: Always affects the player and targets one of their opponents.
Each point of damage is dealt separately, so if you are damaged twice by this spell, each time is considered a separate time this source deals damage.
This card's coin flip has no winner or loser.

cards.originalText: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.

cards.name: Ogre Taskmaster
cards.text: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.
cards.flavor: Ogres learn how to smash stuff even before they learn how to walk.
cards.originalText: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.

cards.name: Okk
cards.text:
Okk can't attack unless a creature with greater power also attacks.
Okk can't block unless a creature with greater power also blocks.
cards.originalText:
Okk can't attack unless a creature with greater power also attacks.
Okk can't block unless a creature with greater power also blocks.

cards.name: Orcish Artillery
cards.text: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to any target and 3 damage to you.
cards.flavor:
"Ready . . . aim . . . fire"
"Ow"

rulings.text: You do not take the 3 points of damage if the ability doesn't resolve because the target is illegal.

cards.originalText: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.

cards.name: Orcish Oriflamme
cards.text: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.
cards.originalText: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.

cards.name: Pillage
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or land. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"Burn their homes. Salt their lands. Nothing survives."
—The Western Paladin
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or land. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Pygmy Pyrosaur
cards.text:
Pygmy Pyrosaur can't block.
{R}: Pygmy Pyrosaur gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
Do not judge a lizard by its size.
—Ghitu proverb
cards.originalText:
Pygmy Pyrosaur can't block.
{R}: Pygmy Pyrosaur gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Pyroclasm
cards.text: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.
cards.flavor:
"When the air burns, only death breathes deep."
—Bogardan mage
cards.originalText: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.

cards.name: Pyrotechnics
cards.text: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.
cards.flavor:
"Who says lightning never strikes twice?"
—Storm shaman

rulings.text: The number of targets chosen for Pyrotechnics must be at least one and at most four. You choose how the damage is divided as you cast the spell, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.
If some but not all of Pyrotechnics's targets become illegal, you can't change the division of damage. Damage that would have been dealt to illegal targets simply isn't dealt.
If an effect creates a copy of Pyrotechnics, the number of targets and division of damage can't be changed. The effect that creates the copy may allow you to change the targets, however.

cards.originalText: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Raging Goblin
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.
cards.originalText: Haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Reckless Embermage
cards.text: {1}{R}: Reckless Embermage deals 1 damage to any target and 1 damage to itself.
cards.flavor: Those who play with fire are bound to get burned.
cards.originalText: {1}{R}: Reckless Embermage deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to itself.

cards.name: Reflexes
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor:
"Be as fast as lightning, and you will be just as deadly."
—Combat trainer
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature has first strike.

cards.name: Relentless Assault
cards.text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
cards.flavor: "Mercy? Mercy is for the playground, not the battleground."

rulings.text: If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

cards.originalText: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. You get an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase this turn.

cards.name: Sabretooth Tiger
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor: "Here, kitty kitty. Here, kitty kitty. Aaaaugh!"
cards.originalText: First strike

cards.name: Seismic Assault
cards.text: Discard a land card: Seismic Assault deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Earth arms itself with fire.
cards.originalText: Discard a land card from your hand: Seismic Assault deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Shatter
cards.text: Destroy target artifact.

rulings.text: Regenerating artifacts can regenerate from this.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Shivan Dragon
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The undisputed master of the mountains of Shiv.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Shock
cards.text: Shock deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.originalText: Shock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Spitting Earth
cards.text: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
cards.flavor:
"We were ready for an attack from the front, sides, or back—but the mage hit us from below."
—Veteran soldier
cards.originalText: Spitting Earth deals damage equal to the number of mountains you control to target creature.

cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.originalText: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Storm Shaman
cards.text: {R}: Storm Shaman gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: She speaks with the voice of the winds, and the earth trembles.
cards.originalText: {R}: Storm Shaman gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Sudden Impact
cards.text: Sudden Impact deals damage to target player equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.
cards.flavor: Caught red-handed.
cards.originalText: Sudden Impact deals damage equal to the number of cards in target player's hand to that player.

cards.name: Trained Orgg
cards.flavor:
"That arm's for bashin'. That one's for smashin'. That one's for scratchin'. And that one . . . I don't know what that one's for."
—Orgg trainer

cards.name: Tremor
cards.text: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
cards.flavor: Where do you run when the earth becomes your enemy?
cards.originalText: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.

cards.name: Volcanic Hammer
cards.text: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Fire finds its form in the heat of the forge.
cards.originalText: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Wall of Fire
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The erupting flames work as both barrier and weapon.
cards.originalText:
(Walls can't attack.)
{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Wildfire
cards.text: Each player sacrifices four lands. Wildfire deals 4 damage to each creature.
cards.flavor: Fire is always at the top of the food chain, and it has a big appetite.
cards.originalText: Each player sacrifices four lands. Wildfire deals 4 damage to each creature.

cards.name: Anaconda
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: You'll never find an anaconda in a swamp. It will always find you first.
cards.originalText: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a swamp.)

cards.name: Ancient Silverback
cards.text: {G}: Regenerate Ancient Silverback. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor: The Phyrexian killing machines couldn't have known the seriousness of their mistake in wounding the ape—they'd never seen it angry.
cards.originalText: {G}: Regenerate Ancient Silverback.

cards.name: Birds of Paradise
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Blanchwood Armor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Forest you control.
cards.flavor:
"There's never been a dwarven smith who could match the marvels that Gaea herself forges."
—The Elvish Champion
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each forest you control.

cards.name: Bull Hippo
cards.text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavor: The merfolk may rule the waters, but hippos have never had much respect for authority.
cards.originalText: Islandwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls an island.)

cards.name: Canopy Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: It keeps the upper reaches of the forest free of every menace . . . except for the spider itself.

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.originalText: Canopy Spider may block as though it had flying.

cards.name: Compost
cards.text: Whenever a black card is put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor:
A fruit must rot before its seed can sprout.
—Yavimaya saying

rulings.text: The ability triggers on a black card being discarded, milled, or countered, as well as a black card going to the graveyard from the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Whenever a black card is put into an opponent's graveyard, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Creeping Mold
cards.text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.
cards.flavor: Mold crept over the walls and into every crevice until the gleaming white stone strained and burst.
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.

cards.name: Early Harvest
cards.text: Target player untaps all basic lands they control.
cards.flavor: "Give it a week and it will feed an army."
cards.originalText: Target player untaps all basic lands he or she controls.

cards.name: Elder Druid
cards.text: {3}{G}, {T}: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
cards.flavor: "I may seem wise to you, but I'm merely a sapling among mighty oaks."

rulings.text: The decision of whether to tap or untap is made on resolution.

cards.originalText: {3}{G}, {T}: Tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: Elvish Archers
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor: The archers have a reputation for attacking without warning. They claim that the first arrow is the warning.
cards.originalText: First strike

cards.name: Elvish Champion
cards.text: Other Elf creatures get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor:
"For what are leaves but countless blades
To fight a countless foe on high."
—Elvish hymn

rulings.text: It affects Elves controlled by all players, not just yours.
This card is now an Elf but has been reworded so that it does not give itself the bonus.

cards.originalText: All Elves get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a forest.)

cards.name: Elvish Lyrist
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Lyrist: Destroy target enchantment.
cards.flavor: To an elf, magic and music are the same.
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Lyrist: Destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Elvish Piper
cards.text: {G}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
From Gaea grew the world, and the world was silent. From Gaea grew the world's elves, and the world was silent no more.
—Elvish teaching

rulings.text: Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.
A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.originalText: {G}, {T}: Put a creature card from your hand into play.

cards.name: Familiar Ground
cards.text: Each creature you control can't be blocked by more than one creature.
cards.flavor: More than any other battlefield, the forest gives the advantage to those who know it best.

rulings.text: When combined with an effect that reads "Each creature you control can't be blocked except by two or more creatures," none of your creatures can be blocked.

cards.originalText: Each creature you control can't be blocked by more than one creature.

cards.name: Femeref Archers
cards.text: {T}: Femeref Archers deals 4 damage to target attacking creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"Bet you can't put it through the eye."
"Left or right?"
cards.originalText: {T}: Femeref Archers deals 4 damage to target attacking creature with flying.

cards.name: Fog
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.originalText: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.name: Fyndhorn Elder
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}{G}.
cards.flavor: "It is useful to be able to speak to the trees. But it is truly wondrous to be able to listen to them."
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Gang of Elk
cards.text: Whenever Gang of Elk becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
cards.flavor:
"I felt the ground shake, so I hid in my tent until the earthquake passed. It passed all right, and it left hoofprints."
—Femeref explorer

rulings.text: Gang of Elk gets the bonus once for each blocker.

cards.originalText: Whenever Gang of Elk becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Giant Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:
Watching the spider's web
—Llanowar expression meaning
"focusing on the wrong thing"

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.originalText: Giant Spider may block as though it had flying.

cards.name: Gorilla Chieftain
cards.text: {1}{G}: Regenerate Gorilla Chieftain.
cards.flavor: A gorilla chief must always be prepared to defend his crown. This leads to some pretty tough apes.
cards.originalText: {1}{G}: Regenerate Gorilla Chieftain.

cards.name: Grizzly Bears
cards.flavor: They've got claws as long as your arm. And they're grouchy. Really, really grouchy.

cards.name: Hurricane
cards.text: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature has flying is only checked on resolution.

cards.originalText: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.

cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavor: Llanowar covers a million square miles, yet nobody enters the forest without the elves knowing it.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
